AlphaTest

Sets the alpha value to be used when running an alpha test. The material will not be renderered if the opacity is lower than this value.

ClipIntersections

Changes the behavior of clipping planes so that only their intersection is clipped, rather than their union.

| Improve this Doc View Source

ClippingPlanes

User-defined clipping planes specified as THREE.Plane objects in world space. These planes apply to the objects this material is attached to. Points in space whose signed distance to the plane is negative are clipped (not rendered).

Declaration
[JsonProperty("clippingPlanes")]
public List<object> ClippingPlanes { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Object>

ColorWrite

Whether to render the material's color. This can be used in conjunction with a mesh's renderOrder property to create invisible objects that occlude other objects.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Opacity

Float in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 indicating how transparent the material is. A value of 0.0 indicates fully transparent, 1.0 is fully opaque. If the material's transparent property is not set to true, the material will remain fully opaque and this value will only affect its color.

Declaration
[JsonProperty("opacity")]
public float Opacity { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Single
| Improve this Doc View Source

Overdraw

Amount of triangle expansion at draw time. This is a workaround for cases when gaps appear between triangles when using CanvasRenderer. 0.5 tends to give good results across browsers.

Declaration
[JsonProperty("overdraw")]
public float Overdraw { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Single
| Improve this Doc View Source

Precision

Override the renderer's default precision for this material. Can be "highp", "mediump" or "lowp".

System.Int32
| Improve this Doc View Source

Transparent

Defines whether this material is transparent. This has an effect on rendering as transparent objects need special treatment and are rendered after non-transparent objects. When set to true, the extent to which the material is transparent is controlled by setting it's opacity property. Default is false.

Declaration
[JsonProperty("transparent")]
public bool Transparent { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
| Improve this Doc View Source
